channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024010354
item.description:
Report X-2024010354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was sent up the conveyor belt to the sorters upstairs, causing it to loosen the caps and for it to leak. A facer saw the hazmat diamond and the leak and pulled the hazmat off the belt and brought it downstairs for it to be processed. DescribePack: Cap came loose due to being sent upstairs and put throught sortation. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened and package was put into a lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2024010119
item.description:
Report E-2024010119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-10T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 29, 2023, one (1) 300-gallon tote of NA1993 was damaged during loading and released approximately 150-gallons of product to the trailer interior, pavement below, and the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. TPM personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor, dock floor and pavement below trailer and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Crews then utilized a vacuum pump to transfer the virgin product from the damaged tote to a new tote and secured for normal transport. All NA1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the four (4) 55-gallon drums and one (1) damaged 275-gallon tote to be added to the facility waste stream.
